fields.description:
Currently, Crucible requires that code be checked in before it can be reviewed. While this works in the early stages of development, it does not work well during late stages just before bit release where some changes might be refused from entering the build. In this latter case, we must have developers perform their change on their own private branch, check in the work, and then create a code review based on that if we want the right to refuse the change. This branch, review, merge model introduces the problem in that if the branch and merge are not done correctly then other problems could be introduced into the build. Also, developers generally strongly prefer not to work on private branches in Peforce in our environment. Working on tip is just much easier, especially when continuous builds are taking place.

So, I would like to see Crucible have the feature where the developer could identify files open for edit in their client workspace for a code review. This would solve a lot of process related problems for us.

Brian Jones
fields.summary: Allow review on checked out files

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When Confluence is started with {{*--disable-all-addons*}} startup options, a banner indicating "{*}Confluence is currently running with all non-system plugins disabled, some functionality may be missing{*}" appears at the top of the site, visible to all users.
After Confluence is started, admins have the ability to manually re-enable those User-Installed plugins. When they are enabled, the banner continues to be present at the header, still indicating to users that no apps are enabled, which is not true this time.
h3. Environment

Confluence Server and Data Center
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Confluence with apps disabled:
{code:java|title=Windows}
start-confluence.bat /disablealladdons
{code}
{code:java|title=Linux}
./start-confluence.sh --disable-all-addons
{code}
 # Notice the banner - "Confluence is currently running with all non-system plugins disabled, some functionality may be missing" present at the top of the site, which is expected
 # As an admin, navigate to the  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/590259974/590058056/1/1398739558493/Cog.png! Icon > *Manage Apps* and enable some or all user-installed apps that got disabled due to the startup option
 # Notice the banner is still present at the top

h3. Expected Results

The banner should go away once user-installed apps are enabled again from the _Manage Apps_ page
h3. Actual Results

The banner is still present at the top, giving out false information to the users that the non-system apps are still disabled.
h3. Workaround

Restart Confluence, without passing the startup option to disable add-ons.
h3. Notes

N/A
fields.summary: "Non-System plugins disabled" banner is incorrectly present after enabling plugins manually
Update the release notes or upgrade notes of 7.11 to include a note on mysqldump to ensure that stored procedures are added in the backup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[Column widths' adjustment/resize on a Confluence table|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/tables-136463.html] does not work as expected, when Confluence is accessed via mobile browser ([*Switch to desktop version*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-confluence-via-your-mobile-browser-947169262.html]; the cursor to drag and resize the columns does not appear. ​

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an e.g. 2x2 table on a Confluence page
# Access this page via your mobile browser (on [desktop version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-confluence-via-your-mobile-browser-947169262.html])
# Try to resize the column on this table

h3. Expected Results
The columns could be resized/adjusted just fine - the experience should mimick what's being observed when trying to resize/readjust the table's column(s) when accessing the page via web browser on a PC. 

h3. Actual Results
The columns could *not* be resized - the cursor to drag and resize the columns does not appear. ​
(i) This has been tested on Google Chrome browser version 96.0.4664.116 (iOS 15) and Chrome 96 (Android OS 12).
 !IMG_5B024A9959AD-1.jpeg|thumbnail!  !photo_2021-12-30_10-39-26.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table column resize when accessing Confluence using mobile browser does not work

h3. Issue Summary

This problem happened when there is a picture in a table.

If you want to input a Japanese hiragana like 'わ' (type w + a) into the place next to picture.  You won't get the right  one ('わ'). It will show 'あ' instead.

*Some conditions*
 * This problem is only reproduces in Windows, not in Mac OS.
 * It only  happened first time after you opened the page. The next time you type 'w' + 'a', it will get right answer.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page, and add a table
 # Drag a picture into the cell of the table
 # Save the page
 # Edit the page and change input mode to Japanese > Hiragana
 # Add Japanese into the place next to the picture. To input a Hiragana (わ), you need to type 'w' + 'a' in keyboard. 

h3. Expected Results

The hiragana of 'わ' shows in the page.
h3. Actual Results

The hiragana of 'あ' shows in the page .
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Wrong Japanese hiragana input when add it next to picture in table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a permission change is applied on the root page of a space with (10x/100x) thousands of nested child-pages, the operation can take significant time to finish.
\\

Occasionally, it can run for a duration long enough to be timed out by the proxy, or by Confluence's UI itself, resulting in an error that says:
"*_There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later._*"
\\


While that is shown on the UI, the user's http thread *may still be running in the background*, visible as:
* (i) a long running task in the *{{atlassian-confluence.log}}*:
{code:bash}
YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS,mmm WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-NNNN] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1628395400000, threadId=XXX, threadName='http-nio-8090-exec-NNNN', userId='userid', type='web-request', summary='/pages/setcontentpermissions.action'}
 -- referer: https://<baseURL>/display/<spaceKey> | url: /pages/setcontentpermissions.action | traceId: <traceID> | userName: userid
{code}
* (i) as a potentially-stuck thread in *{{catalina.out}}*:
{code:bash}
DD-Mmm-YYYY HH:MM:SS.mmm WARNING [ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Standalone]]] org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.notifyStuckThreadDetected Thread "http-nio-8090-exec-NNNN" (id=XXX) has been active for 60,008 milliseconds (since M/D/YY H:MM AM) to serve the same request for https://<baseURL>/pages/setcontentpermissions.action and may be stuck (configured threshold for this StuckThreadDetectionValve is 60 seconds). There is/are 1 thread(s) in total that are monitored by this Valve and may be stuck.
{code}
* (i) (in a Confluence Data Center clustered setup) as an entry in the node's _Live activity_ tab (under _Administration_ > _Clustering_ > _(specific node)_ > '...' button)

\\
Going by the error on the UI, _the user may retry the permission-change operation multiple times, starting a new http thread with every attempt_.
\\

Each subsequent thread will try to factor in the _same change_ as before, on the _same data set_, and _will eventually fail_ with errors like these:
{code:bash}
Failed to add entry to queue; UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'.

YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS,mmm ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-NNNN] [atlassian.xwork.interceptors.TransactionalInvocation] commitOrRollbackTransaction Action /pages/setcontentpermissions.action (SetPagePermissionsAction.setContentPermissions()) is already completed and can not be committed again.
 -- referer: https://<baseURL>/display/<spaceKey>/<rootPageTitle> | url: /pages/setcontentpermissions.action | traceId: <traceID> | userName: <userid>
{code}

\\
The very first attempt will eventually finish, with an entry like this in *{{catalina.out}}* showing the thread's end after a long execution time:
{code:bash}
DD-Mmm-YYYY HH:MM:SS.mmm WARNING [ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Standalone]]] org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.notifyStuckThreadCompleted Thread "http-nio-8090-exec-NNNN" (id=XXX) was previously reported to be stuck but has completed. It was active for approximately 7,200,123 milliseconds.
{code}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a Confluence space with a root page and (10x/100x) thousands of nested child-pages with attachments etc.
 # Modify permissions (add or remove users) at the root page, hit apply

h3. Expected Results
Success if the permission change succeeded. Failure if there was a problem.

h3. Actual Results
* (!) Errors indicating failure may be encountered on the basis of a _timeout_, _even though the operation may still be running, and may eventually finish without errors_.
* (!) Based on the error that is displayed, user is misled into triggering _multiple futile retries_, _all of which will fail_ if the first attempt succeeds.

\\
Confluence:
* does not keep a track of these duplicate ops and allows their (futile) execution (leading to significant CPU/DB/IO/memory usage)
* does not convey an accurate state of the system which lead to ambiguity in the first place


h3. Workaround

# If permissions are changed on a page with (10x/100x) thousands of nested child-pages, even if the UI times out/throws an error, as mentioned in the description, track progress in the following places:
** *{{atlassian-confluence.log}}*
** *{{catalina.out}}*
** (on Confluence Data Center) node's *_Live activity_* tab
\\
\\
# Once thread termination is seen at the places listed above, navigate to _Administration_ > _Cache Management_ > (scroll all the way down) > click _Flush all_. On a multi-node cluster, the cache may need to be flushed on all nodes.
\\
\\
# After flushing the Confluence cache, log out of Confluence, clear the browser-cache, log back in, and confirm if the desired permission change has been applied.
fields.summary: Long running permission-change operations can time out and throw misleading failure messages on the UI but may finish successfully in the background

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a quick or advanced search, exact match results are not promoted in any way. Furthermore, other forms of the word will always be listed after any pages with "stemmed" version, no matter how recent or popular.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with word "Loader" in title (i.e. "Loader not working")
 # Create another with word "Load" in title (i.e. "Load a page")
 # Create a third page with word "load" in title (i.e can't load)
 # Search for "loader" (no quotes)

h3. Expected Results
You get a page with word "Loader" in the title on top of your search results

h3. Actual Results
You get search results for all pages containing the word "Load" because lucene stemmed the word when indexing, however, page with "Loader" in the title will not be in any way prioritised.
!Screenshot 2021-12-22 at 19.42.11.png|width=590,height=292!

In fact, if you have more pages containing the word "load" in the title than can fit into quick search results, page title "Loader not working" will not appear in quick search at all
Furthermore, adding a new page called "Loading something" and searching for "loading" will not prioritise the new page either, despite it being more recent and closer matched keyword. It will also go to the bottom of the results after all the pages with "load" are listed

!Screenshot 2021-12-22 at 19.52.02.png|width=586,height=294!

It appears that search algorithm prioritisation is ignoring exact matching as well as stemmed versions of the word
h4. Notes
Exact match promotion was introduced in CONFSERVER-9261 request
Exact Search with double quotes is also not working as per CONFSERVER-68551 bug
Exact match promotion was still working in 6.13.23
!Screenshot 2021-12-22 at 18.43.37.png|width=264,height=178!!Screenshot 2021-12-22 at 18.43.49.png!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exact matches are not promoted in search results

fields.description:
This is a big ask, but I think it would be amazing if Confluence would only "enable" synchrony on a page when another user started editing while another is editing. We have customers who create large tables in Confluence and run into large input delays when editing solo. We have requested they break up the tables into smaller pages, but the reality of this is limited. I figured, instead of turning of collaborative editing site-wide, could we have it engage under certain conditions?

If this isn't feasible, could we have the option to turn off collaborative editing on a single page/space rather than Confluence-wide? That way pages that need collaborative editing can have it on and larger pages that a single person is updating at a time would run a bit smoother with it off.
fields.summary: Configure collaborative editing to only "enable" on a page when additional users edit it

h3. Issue Summary

* [How to get a list of active users counting towards the Confluence license|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-a-list-of-active-users-counting-towards-the-confluence-license-298978076.html]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Scenario: LDAP user directory which uses blank or anonymous credentials to bind.

Issue: Unable to change an LDAP directory's credentials to blank values if the directory previously had credentials defined, the form will not accept the new (blank) value. You can however add a brand new user directory and not specify credentials during its initial setup and you'll be able to save that choice.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Edit an existing LDAP directory which has credentials defined to bind to it, and which now is needing to change those credentials to blank (NULL) values.

 * Erase the username and/or password as required by the LDAP directory, attempt to test and save changes.

h3. Expected Results

Test is successful and changes can be saved, now binding to the LDAP source with blank/anonymous credentials as desired.
h3. Actual Results

You can erase the previous values but attempts to test this new configuration will fail, leaving you unable to ultimately save the changes. 

The LDAP directory may issue an "Error 49" in response to failing the test.
h3. Workaround

It's possible to create a new user directory and specify the blank credentials from the very beginning, but adding new user directories has consequences which can be avoided by simply editing the database directly and NULL'ing the credentials where they are stored:
{code:java}
UPDATE cwd_directory_attribute
SET    attribute_value = NULL
WHERE  attribute_name = 'ldap.userdn'
        OR attribute_name = 'ldap.password';  {code}
You will need to restart Confluence on all nodes after editing the database's values. 

(i) Please note that the LDAP configuration form for this directory will visually indicate ******** in the password field, due to it being a "password" type field, even after NULL'ing those values out and restarting.
fields.summary: Unable to change an LDAP directory's credentials to blank values if the directory previously had credentials defined

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The special character '&' is breaking search/not returning expected results
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space with the name 'HASE SEC C&R' and then if you 'copy and paste' this space name and try to search it in the space directory, it gives an error "{_}No spaces found.{_}"
 # However, if you DEL the letters until '&', like in this case '&R' then the space becomes searchable. 

h3. Expected Results

COPY-PASTE of the space name should work
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is fetched on auto-search 
h3. Workaround

You need to hit the ENTER key post by pasting the space name so that space search will take place. At this moment the auto-search doesn't trigger if a special character is involved.
fields.summary: Ensure a copied space name including special characters is searchable in the space directory

fields.description:
Our Jira instance is synchronized with three User Directories in three different domains that means they in different countries.

So we faced an issue when user with username 'Jack' has moved from one country to another, thus his new account was created in another domain with the same username 'Jack'.

As we know Jira sync multiple directories one by one from the top. So when it find username in the first directory it does ignore the same username from second directory.

So 'Jack' was not able to login Jira until we renamed his account in the first directory to 'Jack2').

(FYI [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-multiple-directories-938847057.html)]

Would it be possible to improve working with multiple directories so users won't have issues when they try to login from another directory?

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Add ability to sync the same usernames from different User Directories

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you create an event that is set to repeat monthly, you can set whether the event repeats on the same date each month ({*}Same date{*}), or whether it repeats on a certain day/week of the month ({*}Same day each month{*}).

If you select the *Same day each month* setting, there are 2 drop-downs to fill up, one of which is empty by default. If you leave it blank and create the event, then you won't be able to edit the frequency of the event any longer and you see this message:
{quote}(i) This event was set to repeat in another calendar app. To make changes you'll need to edit this event in that app.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a calendar.
 # Create an event of any type.
 # For the *Repeat* field, select {*}Monthly{*}.
 # Ensure the *Same day each month* option is selected.
 # Don't alter the drop-down values for that option. Ensure the first drop-down is blank.
  !1.png|thumbnail!  !3.png|thumbnail! 
 # Save the event.

h3. Expected Results

The event should repeat according to the frequency you've set (monthly). If you edit the event, you should be able to edit its recurrence.
h3. Actual Results

The event repeats weekly. When you edit the event, you see this info message near the "Repeat" field.

!2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Note
This does not occur for other repeat frequencies - daily, weekly, yearly. If you create a monthly event and populate the first drop-down for the *Same day each month* option, then this issue doesn't come up as well.

 !4.png|thumbnail! 

To prevent this from happening, by default, this drop-down should *not* be blank.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior once the event has already been created. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Unable to edit a recurring event's frequency if it was created with a blank "Repeat on" field

fields.description:

Thanks!

The display option to show the username.

fields.description:
I'm current using Confluence to write a policy, people don't like reading policies and I want to improve the accessibility. There is currently an option to add files and I can upload sound files but it takes you to a different screen to view the file and it looks bulky.

The option to add a speaker / sound icon which when clicked plays a sound file would be great.  

Further to that you could add a sound time elapsed bar so people and rewind rather than listening to the whole sound file / section.

To improve this further, the ability to control the speed at which a sound file is played would be great.
fields.summary: FEATURE REQUEST | CONFLUENCE | AUDIO FILES

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When filtering by a specific page on the Task Report macro, tasks from that page and from child pages are shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add tasks to a parent page
# Create a child and add tasks on it as well
# On a separate page add the Task Report Macro and filter by the partent page

h3. Expected Results

Only tasks of the parent show in the Task Rerport Macro as explained [in the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/task-report-macro-590260009.html]:

{quote}
Filter by the task location. The macro will only display tasks in the pages or spaces specified. You can enter a combination of spaces and pages.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results

Tasks from the child pages are also listed on the macro.

h3. Workaround

# Add a label on the parent page
# Edit the Task Report macro
# Add that label in the macro settings
fields.summary: Filtering by a page on Task Report Macro also shows tasks from child pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Sorting is broken in the Page Properties Report Macro, when HTML entities are written in the table cells containing the values to be sorted. In the Page Properties Report Macro there is a parameter that can be set in *Options > Sort By* and when this contains a table heading name the tabular data is sorted by default in this manner. If the page or table using the Page Properties macro is edited or values are appended to the table the page source code changes and wraps the cell values to be sorted in *
* and/or *

* tags. This breaks the default sort order set and displayed in the parent Page Properties Report Macro. However if the heading of the column is manually toggled, the correct sorting is activated. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page with the Page Properties Report Macro that sorts on a heading contained in pages containing a Page Properties Macro with tabular data # Edit the source pages and append values or otherwise update the table on these pages h3. Expected Results Default sorting set in the Page Properties Report Macro is followed and displayed correctly on page load. h3. Actual Results Sorting is broken and does not follow the logic or parameter set in the Page Properties Report Macro The following entities are seen to wrap the cell value and therefore break the sorting. When the heading of the column is manually toggled, the correct sorting is activated. {code:html} Sorted by this column

1.0

{code} h3. Workaround By editing the page source code with the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?tab=overview&hosting=server] one can remove the HTML entities from the table cell value restoring the correct default sort order.
fields.summary: Editing a table in a Page Properties Macro breaks default sorting in the Page Properties Report Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding 5 or more gif attachments to a Confluence page and then when copying this page including the attachments it can take up to a minute to copy the page. The more gifs added the longer it takes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new blank page in Confluence
 # To reproduce the issue you may find some gif files in this Google Drive link: [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1G8rZflEGVHY7PqKl5fQYggDHbzFx3sCx?usp=sharing]
 # Add 5 or more gifs with a total size of approx. 30MB.
 # Go to the page and choose > Copy.
 # Choose a Location for the new page.
 # Check *"include attached files and images"* checkbox.
 # Hit Copy.

h3. Expected Results
 * Page is copied in less than 10 seconds.

h3. Actual Results

When we add *5 gif* files for a total size of {*}30.7MB{*}, the process takes {*}26 seconds{*}. When testing further, after adding one more gif to the page with a size *40.3MB* and in {*}total 71MB{*}, it takes *58 seconds* to complete the copying process.
h3. Workaround

If it is possible to upload your Gif files to an external application, Gifs can be inserted in the page as web links by following the steps:
 # Choose Insert > Files and choose Images from the web.
 # Enter a URL for the image (for example, [http://hostname/path/example.gif]).
 # Choose Preview to check that the URL and image are correct.
 # Tap Insert.

*Notes*
 * The issue is observed on Confluence *v7.4.11* and {*}v7.13.2{*}.
 * There are no specific log messages found in the Support Zip file.
fields.summary: Copying a Confluence Page with gifs attached is slow

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Error 404 when downloading a page that was exported as PDF, Word, etc.
h3. Environment

Operational System: Windows
.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Install Confluence on Windows Server and set Confluence Home as root directory. Example: C:\, D:\, E:\,...
Create a Page
Export page as PDF
h3. Expected Results

File is downloaded
h3. Actual Results

Error 404

Download URL should be: {{[http://host/download/temp/pdfexport-20211209-091221-1301-5/PageName-091221-1301-6.pdf?contentType=application/pdf]}}

Using the configuration as bellow, Confluence is removing {{t}} from {{temp}} and this is the download URL: {{[http://host/download/emp/pdfexport-20211209-091221-1301-5/PageName-091221-1301-6.pdf?contentType=application/pdf]}}

During installation when you select a root directory, {{confluence.home}} is set at {{confluence-init.properties}} for example:
{code:java}
confluence.home = E:\\ 
{code}
In {{confluence-init.properties}} there is a recommendation to not use backslashes:
{code:java}
###########################
# Note for Windows Users  #
###########################
#
# Each backslash in your path must be written as a forward slash.
# - For example:
# c:\confluence\data
#
# should be written as:
#
# c:/confluence/data
{code}
Even if you use forward slash you will see the error.
{code:java}
confluence.home = E:/
{code}
h3. Workaround
 # Create a subfolder for Confluence Home
{code:java}
mkdir e:\confluence-home
{code}

 # Stop Confluence
 # Edit your {{{}confluence-init.properties{}}}. Path on your environment is E:\Confluence\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\confluence-init.properties
 ## Adjust confluence.home:
{code:java}
C:/confluence-Home
{code}

 # Save file
 # Move all folders from Home to new Home subfolder:
{code:java}
move analytics-logs e:\confluence-home\
move attachments e:\confluence-home\
move backups e:\confluence-home\
move bundled-plugins e:\confluence-home\
move confluence.cfg.xml e:\confluence-home\
move imgEffects e:\confluence-home\
move index e:\confluence-home\
move journal e:\confluence-home\
move lock e:\confluence-home\
move logs e:\confluence-home\
move plugins-cache e:\confluence-home\
move plugins-osgi-cache e:\confluence-home\
move plugins-temp e:\confluence-home\
move shared-home e:\confluence-home\
move synchrony-args.properties e:\confluence-home\
move temp e:\confluence-home\
move viewfile e:\confluence-home\
move webresource-temp e:\confluence-home\
{code}

 # Start Confluence

h3. Suggestion

Using installer create a validation to avoid user to select root directory, as they can't select Home to be a subfolder of Confluence install folder.
fields.summary: Error 404 when downloading exported page

fields.description: It would be nice to embed a Solidworks treehouse widget for online collaboration of structures in Confluence. Solidworks treehouse is a standalone application designed to build/manage assembly structures before modeling initiates in Solidworks. The widget would look and feel like the Miro boards widget where a user can pinch/zoom, hover over details, and drag through a board (in this case a model representation) and have ability to launch into the Treehouse application.  Feel free to reach out for any additional questions you may have on this topic.
fields.summary: Confluence <> Solidworks Treehouse Integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding more than one table to a panel, you won't be able to select the content from both tables in edit mode. This doesn't happen outside the panel.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Add three tables and populate it with any macros
 # Still in edit mode, try selecting the content of all three tables

h3. Expected Results

You're able to select all the content
h3. Actual Results

You are not able to select the three tables content. When you reaches the second or third table, the first one will be no longer selected.

Create the tables outside the panel

fields.description:
Greetings.

I'd like to make a very small suggestion, but that I believe to be useful.

Freezing the headers of a table (or tabs) on Settings pages can make a difference when you have dozens of individual users with specific permissions to provide.

This is already a feature on pages that have a table, or multiple tables. The idea is to apply the same feature when checking and changing Settings pages.

Examples:

http://<base-url>/users/viewuserprofile.action?username=<username>

fields.description:
There are many API's in com.atlassian.confluence.pages.PageManager like getPage(long id),getPage(String spaceKey, String pageTitle) which are widely used and now are depricated and suggested to use ContentService.find(Expansion...) but there is no proper documentation of ContentService.find(Expansion...) API in confluence version above 7.
 
Replacement of ContentService.find(Expansion...) is suggested as faster but not able to use it in absence of proper documentation.Can you please guide to the documentation of ContentService class and it's API's.
 
Also few examples of ContentService API's for Pagemanager and SpaceManager API's which are deprecated.
fields.summary: Documentation for ContentService.find

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The office connector documentation [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-office-connector-170492758.html] is out of date. The picture doesn't reflect recent Confluence versions and some of the options are missing or renamed.

Specifically the security segment is missing while the option "Allow authentication tokens in the URL path" has either been removed, or renamed to "Include authentication tokens in the URL path".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit the page
 # Compare with the Office Connector configuration option on a recent version of Confluence.

h3. Expected Results

The two would match.
h3. Actual Results

They don't match.
h3. Workaround

No workaround, documentation needs to be updated.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting Page Properties macro to a page with "Hidden" property, hidden content within macro is searchable and visible in search, even to people with read only access to page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert *Page properties* macro into a page and make it "hidden"
 # Populate a table within the macro with unique values you will search for, for example:
 !Screenshot 2021-12-06 at 14.03.12.png|thumbnail! 
 # Save the page and try to search for one of the unique values

h3. Expected Results
Quick or normal search will return no results as macro is hidden and is not part of the page body. 
As seen in Confluence 6.6.5 version:
 !Screenshot 2021-12-06 at 13.52.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Quick or normal search will return page and expose hidden macro properties in preview:
 !Screenshot 2021-12-06 at 13.57.22.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hidden Page Properties Macro content is exposed in search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page that has external images with {} in the URL, the images gets removed from the page by the editor  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert an external image with curly brackets in the URL
 # Publish the page, image shows correctly
 # Edit the page now, notice that the image disappear

h3. Expected Results

External Images with curly brackets shouldn't get removed from the page on edit
h3. Actual Results

External Images with curly brackets in URL get removed on page edit
h3. Workaround

Replace curly brackets {} in the URL with *%7B* and *%7D* instead before inserting into the page.
fields.summary: External Images with curly brackets in the URL disappear on page edit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "page tools" links such as "Edit", "Save for later", etc are wrapped inside <ul> element and have aria-label="Page tools" inappropriately.
h3. Tested URL

[https://bulldogwiki.internal.atlassian.com/wiki/display/~ssuryavanshi/Test+page+2#main] 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the tested URL with screen reader running.
 # Navigate to the links such as "edit", "save for later" with browse mode ( Ctrl + Opt + left/right arrow keys).
 # Observe the screen reader announcement.

h3. Actual Results

The "page tools" links are wrapped inside <ul> element and have aria-label="Page tools" inappropriately. Screen reader announces as "page tools group". This will not interpret as landmark to the screen reader users. 
h3. Expected Results

The "page tools" list of links should be wrapped inside landmark role and it should have a descriptive label. 

For Example : The screen reader should announce as "page tools, region".

Provide role="region" along with aria-label="Page tools" to the container element. This will be interpreted as a region Landmark to the screen reader users.

Also remove the aria-label="Page tools" provided to the <ul> element.
h3. Screenshot

!Screenshot 2021-11-01 at 3.29.56 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mark page actions correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Health Check is not loading and it just gives a blank screen with the message “The contents of this tab are loading...”  also when Confluence has a Data Source connection with below tomcat settings in datasource:
{code:java}
factory="org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory"
jdbcInterceptors="nl.nlighten.prometheus.tomcat.TomcatJdbcInterceptor(logFailed=true,logSlow=true,threshold=1000,buckets=.01|.05|.1|1|10,slowQueryBuckets=1|10|30)"{code}
On further investigation found below error in logs:
{code:java}
2021-11-01 18:39:26,445 INFO [Catalina-utility-2] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] init Confluence is ready to serve
2021-11-01 18:40:18,477 ERROR [http-nio-27130-exec-4] [ContainerBase.[Standalone].[localhost].[/c7130]] log Unhandled exception occurred whilst decorating page
 -- referer: http://localhost:27130/c7130/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/ | url: /c7130/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/atst-detect-issues/view | traceId: 10a70e6989106ce4 | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException: null value in entry: driver=null
	at com.google.common.collect.CollectPreconditions.checkEntryNotNull(CollectPreconditions.java:32)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap.entryOf(ImmutableMap.java:176)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.put(ImmutableMap.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.getConfiguration(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:162)
{code}
Everything works properly till Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools 1.32.7 version but when the ATST plugin is upgraded to any new version, the Health check started failing with a blank screen. Also, when removing the below settings from the data source connection everything works with the latest version of the Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools plugin.
{code:java}
 factory="org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory" jdbcInterceptors="nl.nlighten.prometheus.tomcat.TomcatJdbcInterceptor(logFailed=true,logSlow=true,threshold=1000,buckets=.01|.05|.1|1|10,slowQueryBuckets=1|10|30)"{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Confluence Data source and use the below settings in the Datasource connections:
{code:java}
 factory="org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory" jdbcInterceptors="nl.nlighten.prometheus.tomcat.TomcatJdbcInterceptor(logFailed=true,logSlow=true,threshold=1000,buckets=.01|.05|.1|1|10,slowQueryBuckets=1|10|30)"{code}
 #  So Datasource connection should be like below:
{code:java}
<Resource name="jdbc/confluence" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
                                factory="org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory"
                                jdbcInterceptors="nl.nlighten.prometheus.tomcat.TomcatJdbcInterceptor(logFailed=true,logSlow=true,threshold=1000,buckets=.01|.05|.1|1|10,slowQueryBuckets=1|10|30)"
         			username="Sanitized by Support Utility"
         			password="Sanitized by Support Utility"
         			driverClassName="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
         			url="jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/test?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8"
         			maxTotal="60"
         			maxIdle="20"
         			defaultTransactionIsolation="READ_COMMITTED"
         			validationQuery="Select 1" /
{code}
 # When you will open the health check it will not load and it will give you the below error in the logs:
{code:java}
2021-11-01 18:39:26,445 INFO [Catalina-utility-2] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] init Confluence is ready to serve
2021-11-01 18:40:18,477 ERROR [http-nio-27130-exec-4] [ContainerBase.[Standalone].[localhost].[/c7130]] log Unhandled exception occurred whilst decorating page
 -- referer: http://localhost:27130/c7130/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/ | url: /c7130/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/atst-detect-issues/view | traceId: 10a70e6989106ce4 | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException: null value in entry: driver=null
	at com.google.common.collect.CollectPreconditions.checkEntryNotNull(CollectPreconditions.java:32)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap.entryOf(ImmutableMap.java:176)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.put(ImmutableMap.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.getConfiguration(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:162)
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The health check should load with every tomcat settings with the latest ATST plugin.

h3. Actual Results

Health check loads a blank page with the latest version of ATST plugin .

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2021-11-01 18:39:26,445 INFO [Catalina-utility-2] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] init Confluence is ready to serve
2021-11-01 18:40:18,477 ERROR [http-nio-27130-exec-4] [ContainerBase.[Standalone].[localhost].[/c7130]] log Unhandled exception occurred whilst decorating page
 -- referer: http://localhost:27130/c7130/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/ | url: /c7130/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/atst-detect-issues/view | traceId: 10a70e6989106ce4 | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException: null value in entry: driver=null
	at com.google.common.collect.CollectPreconditions.checkEntryNotNull(CollectPreconditions.java:32)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap.entryOf(ImmutableMap.java:176)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.put(ImmutableMap.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.getConfiguration(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:162)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is 2 workaround,
 # Migrate the Datasource to Hibernate connections.
 # Or remove the below Tomcat settings from the Datasource:
{code:java}
 factory="org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory"
                                jdbcInterceptors="nl.nlighten.prometheus.tomcat.TomcatJdbcInterceptor(logFailed=true,logSlow=true,threshold=1000,buckets=.01|.05|.1|1|10,slowQueryBuckets=1|10|30)"{code}

fields.description:
Java 11 is bundled since  confluence 7.3. It use TLS 1.2 as default . However, Mysql [does not set it as dafult|https://dev.mysql.com/doc/connector-j/8.0/en/connector-j-usagenotes-known-issues-limitations.html].

When connecting a Mysql DB, the below errior occurs.
{code:java}
Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: No appropriate protocol (protocol is disabled or cipher suites are inappropriate)
{code}
This problem is mentioned in a below KB:
 * [Confluence is not starting with Mysql and Confluence Java 11|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-is-not-starting-with-mysql-and-confluence-java-11-1064089758.html]

 

The customer suggest it will be better if we add this issue into below main document for Mysql DB setup, since it may happen for lots of Mysql customers.
 * [Database Setup For MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-mysql-128747.html]
fields.summary: Add TLS 1.2 issue into the ducument of Database Setup For MySQL

fields.description:

Some Confluence Configuration are only set in Bandana Table in Confluence database.

{_}For exemple: "{_}Compressing an HTTP Response within Confluence"

_This can help_ on troubleshooting and with Health Checks.
h3. Workaround

_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Allow Confluence Support Zip to export data from Bandana Table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a Confluence page, attach a PDF document where this PDF document is exported from another page that contains Code Block macro.
In the resulting preview, the page containing the Code Block macro will appear to be blank.
Clicking on an empty space on the seemingly blank page preview, and then dragging down (to mimic text being highlighted) will reveal that text does exist, but is completely transparent, and therefore unreadable.

h4. Environment
* Confluence 7.4.11 + OpenJDK 11.0.13+8 (MacOS)
* Chrome 96.0.4664.55 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with some text and code block macro in it (you can use this storage format with [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?tab=overview&hosting=server] as an example: [^storage_format.txt])
 # Export this page as a PDF file by using  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/704577869/704577870/2/1517274795952/ellipsis.png|width=16! {{>"Export to PDF"}} functionality
 # Create a new page and attach the exported PDF file to this page by using "Insert files and images" button.
 # Save the page
 # On the view mode, click the attachment to preview it.

h3. Expected Results

Each of the pages should have a visible/readable preview.
h3. Actual Results

The preview for the page which contains the Code Block macro will appear blank, but it does have the original text that's completely transparent/invisible. Please see the below screenshot:

!issue_screenshot.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: PDF export from a page that contains Code Block macro does not displayed properly when it is previewed in another page as an attachment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Table of Contents macro causes editor to scroll back to the top when editing a page instead of maintaining scroll position from when viewing page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh Confluence
# Create a page with all the criteria below:
#* Includes a long table (with many rows)
#* Have Headings in the table
#* Include [Table of Contents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-contents-macro-182682099.html] macro
#* (i) Sample storage format: [^storage format.txt] 
# Publish the page
# While in View Mode, scroll down the page
# Press "E" to enter Edit Mode 

h3. Expected Results
Editor should load in the same position of the page when it was being viewed.

h3. Actual Results
Editor loads from the top of the page, even if the page was lower before Edit hotkey was pressed.
 [^CONFSERVER-75027.mp4] 

h3. Information
* The issue can be replicated on both Chrome and Firefox
* Without the Table of Content macro, the issue is not replicable 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro causes editor to scroll back to the top when editing a page instead of maintaining scroll position from when viewing page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when user enter text with special text mode (monospace, subscript, superscript, strikethrough), Confluence does not highlight the button to indicate user what special text mode is currently being used. This may cause confusion to user if a mode is being use or not when entering content to page.

h3. Suggestion
Implement feature to highlight the special text mode button when it is being used. This feature is available in Cloud but not available in Confluence server/DC.
*Example of requested feature in Confluence server/DC*
 !Screenshot 2021-12-01 at 10.28.04.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: highlight of text mode button when special text mode is being used
